results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = k^2 - k + prime(n), 1<=k<=n.
comment: A117531 gives number of primes in the n-th row;
if T(n,1) is a Lucky Number of Euler then A117531(n)=n, see A014556;
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime-Generating Polynomial
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Lucky Number of Euler
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = k^2 - k + prime(n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 24 2015
